item.title: Israeli army sniper in Chile accused of Gaza war crimes could face justice
item.content:encoded: Rom Kovtun's social media reveal he was holidaying in country, opening door to 'universal jurisdiction' legal jeopardy.

item.title: Fears of ‘slow, certain death’ stalk Tigray amid rumblings of renewed war
item.content:encoded: As tensions escalate between Ethiopia and Eritrea, would new conflict position Addis Ababa against Tigray’s leadership?

item.title: Amid destruction, loss, Gaza clings to Ramadan traditions with resilience
item.content:encoded: Gaza families struggle to find joy during Ramadan amid war's devastation, financial hardship, and displacement.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine talks resume in Geneva as US claims ‘meaningful’ progress
item.content:encoded: The trio will 'continue working towards a deal' in the third round of negotiations, US special envoy Steve Witkoff says.

item.title: Peru impeaches President Jose Jeri over corruption allegations
item.content:encoded: Peru’s Congress has ousted President Jose Jeri just four months into his term over multiple corruption allegations.

item.title: Russia-Ukraine talks live: Geneva talks resume, Kyiv sanctions Lukashenko
item.content:encoded: Ukraine says Russia launched aerial attack as officials from both sides resume US-mediated negotiations.

item.title: Cambodian PM says Thailand occupying ‘deep’ territory after ceasefire
item.content:encoded: Hun Manet calls for border demarcation and says US President Donald Trump's Board of Peace could 'play a role'.

item.title: ‘Quid pro quo’: How Indian firms fund parties whose governments help them
item.content:encoded: Big business shrugs off Supreme Court ban on electoral bonds to donate millions when in trouble, or needing approvals.

item.title: Boxing legend Manny Pacquiao to face Ruslan Provodnikov in April
item.content:encoded: Eight-division ⁠world champion Pacquiao will face former junior welterweight world ⁠champion ⁠Provodnikov on April 18.

item.title: Video: Over 80 UN states condemn Israeli measures in occupied West Bank
item.content:encoded: More than 80 UN nation ambassadors have condemned Israeli measures to tighten its control of the occupied West Bank.

item.title: Ronda Rousey, Gina Carano end MMA retirements to fight in May
item.content:encoded: Rousey will return to MMA for the first time in nearly a decade when she challenges ⁠Carano on ⁠May 16 in California.

item.title: Ramadan begins in Palestine, Gulf; Egypt, Syria, more Muslim states to come
item.content:encoded: Palestinians in Gaza face food shortages, restrictions as Israeli attacks continue during Islamic holy month.

item.title: Nine skiers missing, 6 trapped after north California mountains avalanche
item.content:encoded: Rescuers battle blizzard to save six skiers found trapped after avalanche in the Sierra Nevada mountains in western US.

item.title: Global pressure does little to stop Israel’s anti-Palestinian policies
item.content:encoded: Many Israelis see condemnation as evidence of anti-Semitism, rather than a verdict on their government's actions.

item.title: Gaza welcomes Ramadan amid fragile ‘ceasefire’ and fears of renewed war
item.content:encoded: Despite displacement, Gaza families strive to create joy this Ramadan, navigating grief, scarcity, and fragile peace.

item.title: Philippine VP Sara Duterte announces run for president in 2028
item.content:encoded: Announcement follows multiple impeachment complaints against the vice president over allegations of corruption.

item.title: Updates: Israel steps up attacks, land takeover across occupied West Bank
item.content:encoded: Ramped-up raids, violent settler attacks and bulldozed homes - Israel escalates its assault on the occupied West Bank.

item.title: Washington appoints new US envoy on Tibetan human rights
item.content:encoded: China has previously criticised the role, accusing the US of interfering in China’s internal affairs.

item.title: Over 80 UN member states condemn Israel’s de facto annexation of West Bank
item.content:encoded: UN warns that Israel's plan will lead to widespread dispossession of Palestinian land in the occupied West Bank.

item.title: Iran says ‘good progress’ made in nuclear talks with US in Geneva
item.content:encoded: Top diplomat says Iran and US reached an understanding on 'guiding principles' in nuclear talks as tensions persist.

item.title: Over 80 film workers slam Berlin festival’s silence on Israel’s Gaza war
item.content:encoded: Tilda Swinton and Javier Bardem among actors and directors expressing dismay at Berlinale's 'anti-Palestinian racism'.

item.title: Kremlin official says Russian navy to stop West’s seizure of merchant ships
item.content:encoded: Russian official says Western powers seizing sanctioned vessels carrying Moscow's oil commit 'piracy-like attacks'.

item.title: ‘Tug of war’: Democrats push Trump to release New York City tunnel funds
item.content:encoded: New York Governor Kathy Hochul said the $77m released Tuesday falls short of the amount owed for the transport project.

item.title: Police arrest man with shotgun running towards US Capitol building
item.content:encoded: The suspect, identified as Carter Camacho from the US state of Georgia, was wearing a tactical vest and gloves.

item.title: UN panel says Epstein abuses may constitute ‘crimes against humanity’
item.content:encoded: Experts say newly released documents show the need for an independent investigation into Epstein's sex-trafficking ring.
